document_title: Spinal myeloma: Symptoms, causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Spinal cord tumor is a condition in which tumors develop in the spinal cord or in the dura mater (outer covering of the spinal cord). Spinal cord tumors may include:
Intraspinal tumors arise from cells located inside the spinal cord. For example, astrocytoma, glioma, etc.; Extramedullary, subdural tumors cover the outside of the spinal cord or are located at nerve roots extending out of the spinal cord. Although these tumors are located outside the spinal cord, they can still create pressure on the spinal cord and affect the function of the spinal cord. For example, nerve sheath tumors, neurofibromas, meningiomas, etc.; Extramedullary, extradural tumors: often due to metastatic, secondary tumors..
And whether the tumor is inside the medulla or outside the medulla, whether the tumor has just developed or it has metastasized from other tumors, it can lead to neurological problems, permanent disability or even death. even threaten the patient's life.
Spinal cord tumor is a condition in which tumors develop in the spinal cord or in the spinal dura mater
